org.deeplearning4j.nn.conf.layers

Class EmbeddingLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.nn.conf.layers.Layer
      • org.deeplearning4j.nn.conf.layers.FeedForwardLayer
        • org.deeplearning4j.nn.conf.layers.EmbeddingLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class EmbeddingLayer
extends FeedForwardLayer
    Embedding layer: feed-forward layer that expects single integers per example as input (class numbers, in range 0 to numClass-1) as input. This input has shape [numExamples,1] instead of [numExamples,numClasses] for the equivalent one-hot representation. Mathematically, EmbeddingLayer is equivalent to using a DenseLayer with a one-hot representation for the input; however, it can be much more efficient with a large number of classes (as a dense layer + one-hot input does a matrix multiply with all but one value being zero).
    Note: can only be used as the first layer for a network
    Note 2: For a given example index i, the output is activationFunction(weights.getRow(i) + bias), hence the weight rows can be considered a vector/embedding for each example.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
